metadata.title: QR Code Scanner & Link Cleaner | Clean Links for iPhone
metadata.description: Protect against hidden redirects, phishing and quishing. Scan, clean and share QR codes or links with zero ads, zero logs - always free.

hero.title: Clean Links
hero.subtitle: QR Code Scanner & Link Cleaner in One Free App
hero.description: Clean Links shows the real URL behind every code or short link, strips trackers, and generates a clean URL you can trust.

qrScanner.title: QR code scanner that blocks scams
qrScanner.description: Scan with confidence. Clean Links' QR code reader shows the real URL before your browser opens, stripping hidden trackers and unmasking short links in the same tap. QR-code phishing ("quishing") exploded 15 × in two years-now 1 in 10 phishing emails hides a QR code.¹ Seeing the destination first lets you back out instead of landing on a fake login page.

linkCleaner.title: Link Cleaner: clean any link, anywhere
linkCleaner.description: Paste, share, or shortcut a URL and our Link Cleaner slashes utm_source, fbclid, gclid and hundreds more trackers from 250-plus sites-and counting. The result? A weapon against surveillance economics: by stripping the tracking breadcrumbs baked into short links and URL parameters, you starve social-media giants and ad brokers of the data they hoard to profile and retarget you.

qrGenerator.title: Create share-ready, tracker-free QR codes
qrGenerator.description: Scan a restaurant menu or any other QR code, reveal the true link, then tap Generate QR. In seconds you have a fresh code your friends can scan-no sneaky tracking, just the page you meant to share.

controlCenter.title: One-tap privacy in Control Center & Siri Shortcuts
controlCenter.description: Add Clean Links to Control Center or build a voice Shortcut like "Hey Siri, clean my link." Design your own workflow-perhaps auto-cleaning the clipboard, then opening the result in your preferred browser-whatever fits how you work best.

shareSheet.title: Share a clean URL from any app
shareSheet.description: In Mail, Safari, X, TikTok-anywhere the iOS Share Sheet appears-tap Clean Links. Instantly replace the bloated link with a pristine one before you hit Send. Zero copy-and-paste gymnastics, pure peace of mind.

threat.title: QR Code Phishing & Link-Tracking: The Growing Threat
threat.description: QR code scanners are now everywhere - and so are the scams. In just two years, QR-based phishing exploded from 0.8% to 12.4% of all attacks (a 15× jump)¹, while 1 in 10 phishing emails hides a QR code. Even "harmless" social links aren't exempt: Facebook, X, TikTok and more tag every outbound URL with fbclid, t.co, igshid, gclid and 250+ other trackers that shadow you across the web.
threat.solution: Clean Links removes the trackers and exposes the real destination before you tap-so every scan and click is on your terms.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: Frequently asked questions about Clean Links

whatIs.question: What is Clean Links?
whatIs.answer: Clean Links is a free iOS utility that strips tracking parameters from URLs and reveals the true target behind QR codes and shortened links - so you open only things that you want to, without hidden trackers or redirects.

deviceRequirements.question: Which devices and iOS versions does Clean Links support?
deviceRequirements.answer: Clean Links requires a device that can run iOS 18.0 or later.

whyCreate.question: Why did we create Clean Links?
whyCreate.answer: We initially built it for ourselves to avoid getting "quished" and to protect ourselves from tracking-filled links. We later learned that phishing and quishing are affecting a lot of good people, many of them from a technical background, all over the world. So, we decided to release it for everyone and made it completely free.

privacyProtection.question: How does Clean Links protect my privacy?
privacyProtection.answer: All processing happens on your device - no cookies, identifiers, or analytics data ever leave your phone. Clean Links simply removes known tracking parameters (UTM tags, affiliate IDs, ad-tech tokens) before loading a link. For shortened links, we make requests in an isolated context, without any cookies, sessions etc. This defeats the tracking via cookies that URL shorteners, advertisers and data brokers use to track users.

phishingProtection.question: Can Clean Links block phishing ("quishing") attempts?
phishingProtection.answer: Yes. When you scan a QR code, Clean Links shows you the full, unmasked URL. You get to decide on whether to open it or not. This is unlike the iOS camera app and other paid QR code reader apps, which simply open the link the QR code is pointing to, without your consent.

historyStorage.question: Does Clean Links store my history or scanned QR codes?
historyStorage.answer: No. By design, Clean Links does not log or store links you clean or scan.

cleanWorkflow.question: How do I clean a link I've copied?
cleanWorkflow.answer: You can create an Apple Shortcut that takes the URL from your clipboard, cleans it, and puts the cleaned link back. For example, download this one-tap shortcut: https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/390cf4cc102443518e5fdd0fe9dc4bc0. For even faster access, assign that shortcut to your iPhone's Action button (iPhone 15 Pro and later) so a single press anywhere cleans the clipboard link. You can add Clean Links to your Control Center: choose from two actions-"Open App" or "QR Reader." Access these directly in Control Center or on the Lock Screen, or assign them to the Action button for one-tap cleaning from anywhere. You can also open the Clean Links app manually and paste your URL to clean it.

qrScanning.question: How do I scan a QR code?
qrScanning.answer: Launch Clean Links from your Home Screen, Shortcut, or Action button and point your camera at the code. You'll see the real destination URL before choosing to open it. Clean Links follows any redirects and strips tracking parameters from the final destination-preventing phishing links hidden behind short-link or redirection services.

urlExpansion.question: Can I expand and preview shortened URLs?
urlExpansion.answer: Absolutely. Paste or share any bit.ly, TinyURL, t.co, or other short link into Clean Links. It unshortens all redirect chains and shows you the final URL before you tap.

qrGeneration.question: Can I generate a privacy-safe QR code from a cleaned link?
qrGeneration.answer: Yes. After cleaning a URL, tap "Generate QR" to create a new code you can share completely free of tracking parameters. This is especially handy when you want to share the cleaned link with friends: one tap and they can scan your QR code to open the exact same, tracker-free URL. Also useful when you're trying to share content with your Android using friends, without being surveilled by cough cough: What's that app called again? This helps you and your friends avoid getting plastered with ads related to the content that you just shared, for the next week or two.

systemIntegration.question: Does Clean Links work inside Safari, Mail, and other apps?
systemIntegration.answer: Yes. Clean Links' system-wide Share Sheet extension can be used within Safari, Mail, X (Twitter), Youtube, LinkedIn, or any other app that uses iOS's native Share Sheets.

shortcutsAutomation.question: Can I automate link cleaning with Shortcuts or Siri?
shortcutsAutomation.answer: Clean Links provides App Intents that work with both Apple Shortcuts and Siri. You can build a shortcut that cleans links from your clipboard or anything else. For example, use this "Clean Links" shortcut to grab the link in your clipboard, clean it, and paste the cleaned URL back on to the clipboard: https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/390cf4cc102443518e5fdd0fe9dc4bc0
